qas.question: What are examples of foregoing trees?

plausible_answers.text: northern Appalachians and at higher elevations of the central and southern Appalachians

qas.question: Where are the northern hardwoods the most diverse?
What is the scientific name for the American beech?
Which part of the appalachians have a significant number of shrubs at high elevations?
What are found more frequently in the rich mesic forests?

context: <b4_0>The foregoing trees<b4_0/>, <b0_0>shrubs and herbs<b0_0/> are also more widely distributed in less rich mesic forests that generally occupy coves, stream valleys and flood plains throughout the <b3_0>southern and central Appalachians<b3_0/> at low and intermediate elevations. In the <b1_0>northern Appalachians and at higher elevations of the central and southern Appalachians<b1_0/> these diverse mesic forests give way to less diverse "northern hardwoods" with canopies dominated only by American beech, sugar maple, American basswood (<b2_0>Tilia americana<b2_0/>) and yellow birch and with far fewer species of shrubs and herbs.
